intro: Aphyllon parishii subsp. brachylobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed aphyllon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
